pullRequest.body:
Possibly useful lemma about the nth prime number.

Co-authored-by: Pol'tta / Miyahara K≈ç <52843868+Komyyy@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Thomas Browning <tb65536@uw.edu>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
I misunderstood that a non-reviewer could ask a maintainer to merge with the command ‚Äúmaintainer merge‚Äù.
I am not a reviewer and apologize for the review even though I do not have the authority to do the merge.
Your review is welcome! I'm surprised how much you could shorten the proof. Thanks!

@Komyyy Speaking as a member of the reviewer team: we encourage and are grateful for every reviews! It makes our work easier and also let PR authors wait less. If you think this PR (or any other one) is good to go, give it an "approve" and a reviewer / maintainer will get to it soon.
I wonder if we should have `n + f 0 <= f n` if `f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï` is `StrictMono`.

> I wonder if we should have `n + f 0 <= f n` if `f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï` is `StrictMono`.

Or slightly more generally:
```
lemma StrictMono.add_le {f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï} (hf : StrictMono f) (m n : ‚Ñï) : m + f n ‚â§ f (m + n)  := by
  rw [add_comm m, add_comm m]
  induction' m with m ih
  ¬∑ rw [add_zero, add_zero]
  ¬∑ rw [‚Üê add_assoc, ‚Üê add_assoc, succ_le]
    exact ih.trans_lt (hf (n + m).lt_succ_self)

/-- The `n`th prime is greater or equal to `n + 2`. -/
lemma add_two_le_nth_prime (n : ‚Ñï) : n + 2 ‚â§ nth Prime n :=
  zeroth_prime_eq_two ‚ñ∏ (nth_strictMono infinite_setOf_prime).add_le n 0
```

### PR summary [d67f2cee6b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13283/commits/d67f2cee6b16134f4c9f0aa6d74696ac1efa48c2)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ StrictMono.add_le_nat`
`+ add_two_le_nth_prime`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Apparently the name change in the last commit clashes with the PR comment? What to do?

EDIT: Resolved by merging master.
OK, so the fail is ignored. Let's see...

LGTM.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

Thanks!

bors merge
Wait what?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9554513139/job/26335723047)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9554513139/job/26335723424)

```suggestion
/-- The `n`th prime is greater or equal to `n + 2`. -/
lemma add_two_le_nth_prime (n : ‚Ñï) : n + 2 ‚â§ nth Prime n := by
  induction' n with n ih
  ¬∑ exact ge_of_eq zeroth_prime_eq_two
  ¬∑ exact le_trans (add_le_add_right ih 1)
      (succ_le_of_lt <| nth_strictMono infinite_setOf_prime n.lt_succ_self)
```
`GT.gt`(`a ‚â• b`) is defined as an abbreviation of `LT.lt` (`b ‚â§ a`) so using the latter is more preferable.
Also, we can golf (working piece of a proof as short as possible) here.
This is true for some other types as well (e.g., for `Int`, if you assume `0 ‚â§ m`), so I suggest that you add "_nat" to the name of this lemma.
Done.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/PrimeCounting): Lemma: The `n`th prime is greater or equal `n + 2`.
